solution:
Let $w=y-3z$.  The equations become

\begin{align*}
3x+4w&=10,\\
-2x-3w&=-4.
\end{align*}

Adding four times the second equation to three times the first equation,

$$9x+12w-8x-12w=30-16\Rightarrow x=\boxed{14}.$$
model_solution:
Multiply the first equation by 2 and the second equation by 3.
Add the two equations together.
Eliminate the y variable by dividing the resulting equation by -13.
Substitute z = 2 into the equation obtained after eliminating the y variable.
Substitute x into one of the original equations.
Substitute x into the first original equation.
Substitute z = 2 into the first original equation.
Substitute x = 8/13 - 6z/13 into the second original equation.
Add the two equations together.

full_steps: Multiply the first equation by 2 and the second equation by 3.
Eliminate the y variable by dividing the resulting equation by -13.
Substitute z = 2 into the equation obtained after eliminating the y variable.
Substitute x into one of the original equations.
Substitute x into the first original equation.
Substitute z = 2 into the first original equation.
Substitute x = 8/13 - 6z/13 into the second original equation.
